snippet: Advocates hope the State Senate will pass a bill in support of the New York City churches next week.
abstract: New York State Senate will consider a measure that would allow the practice of letting churches hold services in New York City public schools to continue; affected congregations are looking for new homes and pondering uncertain futures as starting date for the New York City Education Department's ban on the practice looms near.
lead_paragraph: Advocates hope the State Senate will pass a bill in support of the New York City churches next week.

headline.seo: Churches Push for Law Allowing Them to Remain in Public Schools
headline.main: Albany Is Urged to Let Churches Keep Using Schools
headline.print_headline: Albany Is Urged to Let Churches Keep Using Schools
